body.p: The BSD# Project is devoted to porting the Mono .NET framework and applications to the FreeBSD operating system.

Mono 2.8 has been released a few days ago and is already available in the BSD# repository. The updates breaks a few ports so the lang/mono updated in the FreeBSD ports tree will be delayed until those programs are fixed for a smoother update experience.

Work is in progress to include some long-awaited ports such as deskuils/gnome-do but they require a lot of testing and hacking because they have clearly been designed to run on GNU/Linux and portability has never been a priority (which is quite amusing if you consider portability is the main reason to be for mono).

help.task: If you have some time, test mono ports and send feedback.
If you have more time, join the BSD# Team! There are many ways to help out!
Currently low priority, some mono hackers who don't user FreeBSD would be interested in a debug live-image of FreeBSD to help us diagnose and fix bugs more efficiency.
